items.title: Jamaicans take shelter as Hurricane Melissa bears down as category 5 storm
items.standfirst: Landfall expected in coming hours amid warnings of catastrophic flooding, and landslidesHurricane Melissa – follow latest updates liveJamaicans have started to take shelter from Hurricane Melissa as the category 5 storm neared the coast amid warnings of catastrophic flooding, landslides and extensive infrastructure damage.The slow-moving giant, the strongest hurricane to hit Jamaica since records began in 1851, is set to make landfall early on Tuesday and to linger over the island. Continue reading...

items.title: Hurricane Melissa threatens to unleash record destruction on Jamaica
items.standfirst: Brutal winds and torrential rain battered Jamaica as Hurricane Melissa, a Category 5 storm, was set to make landfall on the Caribbean island nation on Tuesday. Prime Minister Andrew Holness warned it could be Jamaica’s most destructive storm on record. Melissa has already killed at least four people in Haiti and the Dominican Republic.
items.content: Brutal winds and torrential rain battered Jamaica as Hurricane Melissa, a Category 5 storm, was set to make landfall on the Caribbean island nation on Tuesday. Prime Minister Andrew Holness warned it could be Jamaica’s most destructive storm on record. Melissa has already killed at least four people in Haiti and the Dominican Republic.

clusters.title: The 92-year-old president who never loses

bullet_summary: Reported by BBC World, France24, Al Jazeera and others

items.title: The 92-year-old president who never loses
items.standfirst: Cameroon's Paul Biya has extended his 43-year rule by wining a heavily disputed election.
items.content: Cameroon's Paul Biya has extended his 43-year rule by wining a heavily disputed election.

items.title: Sudan's RSF overrun the army's last stronghold in the Darfur region
items.standfirst: In tonight's edition, the paramilitary force RSF has ousted the Sudanese army from El-Fasher, its last stronghold in Darfur, after months of fighting. Also, Paul Biya, the world's oldest serving ruler, secured an eighth term in office on Monday, after days of protesters' clashes with security forces as opposition supporters demanded credible results. And Ivory Coast's President Alassane Ouattara has also won a fourth term.
items.content: In tonight's edition, the paramilitary force RSF has ousted the Sudanese army from El-Fasher, its last stronghold in Darfur, after months of fighting. Also, Paul Biya, the world's oldest serving ruler, secured an eighth term in office on Monday, after days of protesters' clashes with security forces as opposition supporters demanded credible results. And Ivory Coast's President Alassane Ouattara has also won a fourth term.

items.content: 92-year- old Paul Biya, the world's oldest head of state, claims victory in a disputed election, sparking unrest across the country already grappling with violence, corruption, and political tension.(Image credit: AFP via Getty Images)

items.title: Cameroon's president re-elected at 92
items.standfirst: The world's oldest head of state, Paul #Biya, 92, extended his more than four-decade rule, securing an eighth term in #Cameroon's presidential poll - results which his rival swiftly rejected. On October 26, four people were killed in #clashes between security forces and supporters of the opposition in the economic capital Douala.
items.content: The world's oldest head of state, Paul #Biya, 92, extended his more than four-decade rule, securing an eighth term in #Cameroon's presidential poll - results which his rival swiftly rejected. On October 26, four people were killed in #clashes between security forces and supporters of the opposition in the economic capital Douala.

items.title: Cameroon re-elects world's oldest president

items.content: The world's oldest president has again won the vote in Cameroon, despite violent clashes ahead of the election.

items.content: As 10 defendants begin trial in Paris for allegedly cyberharassing the French First Lady, Vedika Bahl takes a look at the timeline of how unsubstantiated conspiracy theories about her gender began to circulate, how the claims exploded globally after Candace Owens got involved, and how the Macrons have pushed back with legal action.

items.standfirst: Trial is latest phase in legal battle against false claim that French first lady is a man named Jean-Michel TrogneuxTen people have gone on trial in Paris charged with online harassment of Brigitte Macron – the latest phase of a legal battle on both sides of the Atlantic against the false claim that the French first lady is a man named Jean-Michel Trogneux.The president, Emmanuel Macron, and his wife filed a defamation lawsuit in the US at the end of July, in connection with a rumour amplified and repeated online that Brigitte Macron was born a man. items.title: Trump does not rule out seeking third term - but says he will not use VP loophole

items.content: Trump rules out running for vice-president, an idea floated by supporters to circumvent the US constitution which bars him from running again.

ai_summary: Trump stated he would not seek the Vice President position in 2028.

clusters.title: Lithuania accuses Belarus of 'hybrid attack' after contraband balloons shut airports
clusters.neutral_headline: Lithuania Accuses Belarus of Hybrid Attack with Contraband Balloons
bullet_summary: The NATO and EU member said the balloons, allegedly launched by Belarusian smugglers, carried illegal cigarettes and prompted Lithuania to shut its last two border crossings with Belarus
Reported by France24, Guardian World

items.title: Lithuania accuses Belarus of 'hybrid attack' after contraband balloons shut airports
items.standfirst: Lithuania accused Belarus on Monday of a “hybrid attack” after dozens of contraband-filled balloons forced the temporary closure of two airports. The NATO and EU member said the balloons, allegedly launched by Belarusian smugglers, carried illegal cigarettes and prompted Lithuania to shut its last two border crossings with Belarus.
items.content: Lithuania accused Belarus on Monday of a “hybrid attack” after dozens of contraband-filled balloons forced the temporary closure of two airports. The NATO and EU member said the balloons, allegedly launched by Belarusian smugglers, carried illegal cigarettes and prompted Lithuania to shut its last two border crossings with Belarus.

items.title: Lithuania says it will shoot down smuggling balloons from Russia’s ally Belarus
items.standfirst: PM blames Alexander Lukashenko for not stopping ‘hybrid attacks’, which closed Vilnius airport four times last weekEurope live – latest updatesLithuania’s prime minister has authorised the shooting down of smuggling balloons that cross the border from Russia’s ally Belarus, calling them “hybrid attacks” in an echo of the term used to describe Moscow’s destabilisation efforts.Incursions by balloons carrying contraband cigarettes prompted the Nato and EU member state to close Vilnius airport four times last week and shut its border crossings with Belarus temporarily. Continue reading...
items.content: PM blames Alexander Lukashenko for not stopping ‘hybrid attacks’, which closed Vilnius airport four times last weekEurope live – latest updatesLithuania’s prime minister has authorised the shooting down of smuggling balloons that cross the border from Russia’s ally Belarus, calling them “hybrid attacks” in an echo of the term used to describe Moscow’s destabilisation efforts.Incursions by balloons carrying contraband cigarettes prompted the Nato and EU member state to close Vilnius airport four times last week and shut its border crossings with Belarus temporarily. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Lithuania accused Belarus of a "hybrid attack" involving balloons.
The balloons carried contraband, forcing airport closures.
Two airports were temporarily shut down due to the balloons.
Lithuania closed its last two border crossings with Belarus.
The balloons allegedly contained illegal cigarettes.

clusters.title: UN slams Israel after attack on peacekeepers in Lebanon
clusters.neutral_headline: UN and France Condemn Israel After Attack on Peacekeepers
bullet_summary: Reported by Al Jazeera, France24

items.title: UN slams Israel after attack on peacekeepers in Lebanon
items.standfirst: UN spokesman says incident involved a drone dropping a grenade near a patrol, and a tank opening fire on peacekeepers.
items.content: UN spokesman says incident involved a drone dropping a grenade near a patrol, and a tank opening fire on peacekeepers.

items.title: United Nations, France condemn Israel for attack on UN peacekeeping troops in Lebanon
items.standfirst: The United Nations and France on Monday condemned Israel for an attack on peacekeeping troops in southern Lebanon, after they neutralised an Israeli drone that reportedly flew over their patrol in an "aggressive manner" on Sunday. According to a French diplomatic source, the troops involved in Sunday's incident were French.
items.content: The United Nations and France on Monday condemned Israel for an attack on peacekeeping troops in southern Lebanon, after they neutralised an Israeli drone that reportedly flew over their patrol in an "aggressive manner" on Sunday. According to a French diplomatic source, the troops involved in Sunday's incident were French.

ai_summary: The UN condemned Israel for an attack on peacekeeping troops.
The incident involved a drone dropping a grenade near a patrol.
A tank also opened fire on the UN peacekeepers.
French troops were involved in the incident.
The UN and France both criticized the Israeli actions.

clusters.title: Argentina midterm elections seen as confidence vote for Milei's economic refoms
clusters.neutral_headline: Milei's Party Gains Ground in Argentina's Midterm Elections
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, Guardian World

items.title: Argentina midterm elections seen as confidence vote for Milei's economic refoms
items.standfirst: Even if Argentine President Javier Milei's La Libertad Avanza party is still short of a majority in parliament after midterm elections, the self-described "anarcho-capitalist" now has more room to push ahead with radical economic reforms. Since coming to power in 2023, Milei has cut budgets for education, pensions and infrastructure and laid off tens of thousands of public sector workers. The president is also credited with lowering inflation, winning praise from US counterpart Donald Trump.
items.content: Even if Argentine President Javier Milei's La Libertad Avanza party is still short of a majority in parliament after midterm elections, the self-described "anarcho-capitalist" now has more room to push ahead with radical economic reforms. Since coming to power in 2023, Milei has cut budgets for education, pensions and infrastructure and laid off tens of thousands of public sector workers. The president is also credited with lowering inflation, winning praise from US counterpart Donald Trump.

items.title: Javier Milei hails ‘tipping point’ as his far-right party wins Argentina’s midterm elections
items.standfirst: Result falls short of giving Milei a congressional majority but surprises many analysts after series of scandalsThe party of Argentina’s far-right president, Javier Milei, has won Sunday’s midterm elections after a campaign in which Donald Trump announced a $40bn bailout for the country and made continued aid conditional on the victory of his Argentinian counterpart.With more than 99% of ballots counted, La Libertad Avanza secured 40.8% of the nationwide vote, in an election widely seen as a de facto referendum on the self-styled anarcho-capitalist’s nearly two years in power. The Peronist opposition, Fuerza Patria, secured 31.7%. Continue reading...
items.content: Result falls short of giving Milei a congressional majority but surprises many analysts after series of scandalsThe party of Argentina’s far-right president, Javier Milei, has won Sunday’s midterm elections after a campaign in which Donald Trump announced a $40bn bailout for the country and made continued aid conditional on the victory of his Argentinian counterpart.With more than 99% of ballots counted, La Libertad Avanza secured 40.8% of the nationwide vote, in an election widely seen as a de facto referendum on the self-styled anarcho-capitalist’s nearly two years in power. The Peronist opposition, Fuerza Patria, secured 31.7%. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Milei's party is short of a majority after the midterm elections.
Milei can now push ahead with economic reforms.
Milei has cut budgets for education, pensions, and infrastructure.
He has also laid off thousands of public sector workers.
Trump praised Milei for lowering inflation in Argentina.

clusters.title: 'Trapped and terrified': warnings as Sudanese militia advance on Darfur city
clusters.neutral_headline: Fears Grow as Sudanese Militia Claims El Fasher Capture
bullet_summary: The group said on Sunday that it had seized control of the army’s main base in the city in Darfur, where famine was declared in a displacement camp last year
Reported by NPR News, Guardian World

items.title: 'Trapped and terrified': warnings as Sudanese militia advance on Darfur city
items.standfirst: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces claim they've seized the Sudanese army's last base in El Fasher, Darfur — trapping hundreds of thousands and stoking fears the country could split in two.
items.content: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces claim they've seized the Sudanese army's last base in El Fasher, Darfur — trapping hundreds of thousands and stoking fears the country could split in two.(Image credit: Lynsey Addario)

items.title: Grave fears for civilians after Sudanese paramilitary claims capture of El Fasher
items.standfirst: RSF says it has seized control of army’s main base in Darfur, home to famine-stricken displacement campFears are growing for hundreds of thousands of civilians trapped in El Fasher, Sudan, after the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces said it had captured the city, which it has been besieging for more than a year in the country’s civil war.The group said on Sunday that it had seized control of the army’s main base in the city in Darfur, where famine was declared in a displacement camp last year. It then released a statement saying it had “extended control over the city of El Fasher from the grip of mercenaries and militias”. Continue reading...
items.content: RSF says it has seized control of army’s main base in Darfur, home to famine-stricken displacement campFears are growing for hundreds of thousands of civilians trapped in El Fasher, Sudan, after the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces said it had captured the city, which it has been besieging for more than a year in the country’s civil war.The group said on Sunday that it had seized control of the army’s main base in the city in Darfur, where famine was declared in a displacement camp last year. It then released a statement saying it had “extended control over the city of El Fasher from the grip of mercenaries and militias”. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The Rapid Support Forces claimed to seize the army's base in El Fasher.
Hundreds of thousands of civilians are trapped in the city.
Famine was declared in a displacement camp in El Fasher.
The RSF has been besieging the city for over a year.
The RSF stated they extended control over El Fasher.

clusters.title: Cameroon’s Paul Biya re-elected for 8th term amid protests
clusters.neutral_headline: Paul Biya Wins Eighth Term as Cameroon President
bullet_summary: His main rival, Issa Tchiroma Bakary, who claimed victory based on his own tally, denounced the result and said civilians outside his home were fired upon
Paul Biya, 92, said to have won 53
The country’s constitutional council said Biya had won 53

items.title: Cameroon’s Paul Biya re-elected for 8th term amid protests
items.standfirst: Cameroon’s 92-year-old president Paul Biya has been re-elected for an eighth term with 53.7% of the vote, according to the Constitutional Council. His main rival, Issa Tchiroma Bakary, who claimed victory based on his own tally, denounced the result and said civilians outside his home were fired upon. Protests erupted in several cities, leaving four people dead and over 100 arrested, as authorities banned public gatherings and dismissed allegations of fraud.
items.content: Cameroon’s 92-year-old president Paul Biya has been re-elected for an eighth term with 53.7% of the vote, according to the Constitutional Council. His main rival, Issa Tchiroma Bakary, who claimed victory based on his own tally, denounced the result and said civilians outside his home were fired upon. Protests erupted in several cities, leaving four people dead and over 100 arrested, as authorities banned public gatherings and dismissed allegations of fraud.

items.title: World’s oldest serving head of state declared winner in Cameroon election
items.standfirst: Paul Biya, 92, said to have won 53.66% of vote after volatile two weeks since election when opponent claimed victoryPaul Biya, the world’s oldest serving head of state, has been declared the winner of Cameroon’s election, granting him an eighth term that could keep him in office until he is nearly 100.The country’s constitutional council said Biya had won 53.66% of the vote, while his former ally turned challenger, Issa Tchiroma Bakary, got 35.19%. Continue reading...
items.content: Paul Biya, 92, said to have won 53.66% of vote after volatile two weeks since election when opponent claimed victoryPaul Biya, the world’s oldest serving head of state, has been declared the winner of Cameroon’s election, granting him an eighth term that could keep him in office until he is nearly 100.The country’s constitutional council said Biya had won 53.66% of the vote, while his former ally turned challenger, Issa Tchiroma Bakary, got 35.19%. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Paul Biya, 92, was re-elected for an eighth term.
Biya received 53.7% of the vote, according to the council.
Protests erupted in several cities after the election.
Authorities banned public gatherings due to the protests.
Biya's opponent denounced the election results.
